chapter.title: Getting Started with Modern FCC
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the Web interface through which you use Modern Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.condition: TITLE=Services: Getting Started with Modern FCC;ACCESS=DB_UX
section.title: Welcome and Log In
section.para:
When you connect to Fusion Corporate Channels , a Welcome/Login page is displayed. Enter the provided credentials, Corporate ID, Username and password, then click Login.
When you are logging in for the first time, the Registration page is displayed. Read the terms and conditions, enter any required details for registration, and click Register to continue further.
Login Page

The Support link under the Login menu takes you to Finastra site. Fusion Corporate Channels offers the flexibility to change the URL address. The information on URL update is available in SDK documentation.

section.title: The Fusion Corporate Channels Client Landing Page
section.para:
Once authenticated, the product landing page is displayed. The page displays a list of cards based on user access. Click on any of the available cards to navigate to respective dashboard, like click on Trade Services card will take you to Trade Dashboard.
Fusion Corporate Channels supports Trade Dashboard and Cash Dashboard for the current release, click on other cards will redirect user to product feature page.
Product Landing page is an optional screen and can be disabled by checking the Don't show this Landing Page again! check box. You can enable the landing page again by checking the Show Landing Page check box in the User Profile Panel
on the Fusion Corporate Channels Dashboard.

The Landing page shown below is only for illustration purpose, the options available on the page are based on products licensed by customer. The image illustrates the complete portfolio of FCC offering.

The main landing area displays major products and functionalities offered by FCC, a brief description on each of the products and functionalities are listed below:
Dashboard - Displays the Fusion Corporate Channels global Dashboard.
Lending Services - Displays the Lending features page.
Account Services - Displays the Account Services menu.
Administration - Displays the Administration menu.
Treasurer FCC Dashboard - Displays the Power BI report, for details refer Power BI installation guide or contact Finastra.
Treasury Services - Displays the Treasury features page.
FSCM Services - Displays the FSCM features page.
Common Services - Displays the Common Services feature page.
Trade Services - Displays the Trade dashboard which shows transactions related to trade module.
Cash Services - Displays the Cash dashboard which shows transactions related to cash module.
For more information on each of these verticals, see the standard MP_user_client_en guide.

section.title: Configuring Client Landing Page
section.para:
This section guides the user to disable/enable the FCC Client Landing page.
The Landing page is enabled by default, the user can choose to disable the page.

To disable the FCC landing page, follow the instructions listed below:
Scroll down to the bottom of the Landing page.
Select the Don't show this landing page again! checkbox to disable the Landing page.
Logout of the current session and login to verify that the Landing page is disabled.

To enable the FCC landing page, follow the steps listed below:
Click User Profile Panel and select the Show Landing Page checkbox.
Logout of the current session and login to verify that the Landing page is enabled.
The Show Landing Page field is greyed out when the Landing page is already enabled.

section.condition: TITLE=The Fusion Corporate Channels Global Dashboard;ACCESS=DB_UX_01
section.title: The Fusion Corporate Channels Global Dashboard
section.para: Once you login, the Landing page is displayed. Click Dashboard to display the global dashboard screen. However, if the landing page is disabled, then the global dashboard is displayed as the first page after user authentication.

The Global Dashboard shown below is only for illustration purpose, the options available on the page are based on products licensed and the dashboard profile selected by the corporate user. The image illustrates the Standard Dashboard profile.
The product specific dashboards reflect the data specific to the product.
Each of the sections of the Fusion Corporate Channels Global Dashboard are listed here:

listitem.para: The Fusion Corporate Channels Banner
Navigation Bar
Dashboard Widgets
Personalize Dashboard

section.para: In many cases, there are multiple methods of navigating to specific functions or options. Some of these methods will be discussed in this guide.

section.title: The Banner
section.para: The Fusion Corporate Channels banner is the same on every page. The details of each icon/menu is described in this section. The following image illustrates the FCC banner.

listitem.para: Hamburger Icon:

The hamburger icon
allows you to view and navigate through the menu options..
The menu options are displayed based on your role and permissions.
Finastra/Bank Logo:

The Finastra logo
next to hamburger icon, is a link to the Finastra website.
Bank can configure another link as part of customization. Refer standard Fusion Corporate Channels SDK documentation for more information.
Home button:

The home
icon allows you to get back to global dashboard screen.
Search button:

The search icon
allows you to perform a global search. Click Search and choose the required option to specify the search criteria. Search Options
Transaction: This option allows you to search with either exact or a partial transaction reference. The following screen displays the search results:
In the search results, hover over the required transaction to display the relevant actions that you can perform.
You can hover over the icons to display the tool-tips. Click on the required icon to display the relevant page to take appropriate action on the transaction.
Beneficiary: This option allows you to search with either exact or partial beneficiary name. The following screen displays the search results:
Upon providing partial beneficiary name all the beneficiaries which meet the search criterion are listed, you can select the desired beneficiary to list all the relevant transactions.
In the search results, hover over the required transaction to display the relevant actions that you can perform.
You can hover over the icons to display the tool-tips. Click on the required icon to display the relevant page to take appropriate action on the transaction.
Menu: This option allows you to search with either exact or partial menu name. The following screen displays the search results:
Upon providing partial menu name all the menu items which meet the search criterion are listed, you can select the desired menu item to navigate to the item page.
List Menu:

The list menu
, lists all the modules that you are entitled to use. Upon clicking any of the listed modules you are taken to legacy dashboard. An illustration of list menu is shown below:
Based on the user access you are taken to either to dashboard or feature page of the selected module.

Help: Click on this icon
to open the online help for the screen that you are on.

Change Language: Click on this icon
to change the language of Fusion Corporate Channels.
User Profile Panel:

The User Profile panel
shows the logged in user and also provides the following features:
Toggle Menu:
This feature enables/disables the navigation bar on FCC Dashboard, which lists all the available modules to the user.
Navigation Bar
Show Landing Page:
This option when clicked, opens the landing page first after fresh login.
Profile Selection:
This option enables you to select the Dashboard profile from available options.
The dropdown lists all the profiles offered by Fusion Corporate Channels and personalized profiles created by you.
Logout:
The logout option is available to the user in User Profile panel.
View Profile:
The View Profile link takes the user to Change Profile page to make the required updates.

Contact Help Desk: Click on this icon
to send an email to the bank helpdesk, for information or support.

My Pending List: Click on this icon
to view the list of transactions that are created but have not been submitted due to insufficient authorization.
Logout:
The Logout button to log out of the Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: As the banner is displayed on all pages, these options can be selected at any time.

section.title: Navigation Bar
section.para:
The Navigation Bar is displayed on all the pages below the Banner and it provides links to various functions and features of Fusion Corporate Channels. The list of features and functions are displayed based on your role and permissions.
The Toggle Menu in User Profile Panel enables/disables the navigation menu on FCC Dashboard.
The availability of the menus and their functions, is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those menus containing functions the user is authorised to use will be displayed.
Navigation Bar

listitem.para: Create Initial Drawdown, Loan Increase, Adhoc Payments, Remittance Instructions, Track documents (only listing), Loan Repricing (only Comprehensive), Borrower bills (only listing) and Loan history.

Enables to view Account summaries and statements, view Transaction lists, inquire on and execute Batch processing, produce reports, list transactions that require authorization within your authority level, Term Deposits and Loans, and view advices and notifications received from the Bank.

Manages the setup and use of the Fusion Corporate Channels at the customer or Entity level. Most users will only be able to access the Change Profile service (also accessible from the banner). Other services are only available to client administrator, and are described in the Client Administrator Guide. This item is only available to Client administrator and will not be covered in this guide. For more information, see the Client Administrator Guide.

Processes Foreign Exchange (FX) instruments such as Deals, Wires and Transfers, and Certificate of Deposit (CD); creates, maintains, and submits the FX Spot, FX Forward, and FX Window Forward trade requests; adds, edits, and releases bank payment instructions; processes payments, internal fund transfers, and external fund transfers; and initiates a CD, attaches instructions, and allows to rollover a CD.
Creates Invoicing, Purchase Orders and Credit Notes.

Enables to make payments to and transfer money to local and external accounts, create money orders and cheques for payment, create remittance advices, upload files into the Fusion Corporate Channels, and create Bulk Orders for payment or collection of orders.

section.title: Dashboard Widgets
section.para:
This section describes the various portlets that Modern Dashboard provides. A few portlets like Bills Outstanding, Loans Outstanding, Available Balance - Import and Available Balance - Export display the data in the following four graphical formats:
Pie Chart
Bar Chart
Logarithmic Chart
Grid View
sub Burst Chart
Select the currency from dropdown to view the data representation in the desired currency.

section.title: Daily Authorization Limit
section.para: This portlet displays the daily authorization limit for the logged in user.

section.title: User Information
section.para: This portlet displays the overall account balance in the selected currency. Click View All Accounts to display the Account Summary screen, where you can search and view all the associated accounts.

section.title: Currency Wise Account Balance
section.para: This portlet displays the Currency Wise Account Balance in a list format. Click View All to display the Account Summary screen, where you can search and view all the associated accounts.

section.title: Mini Statement
section.para: This widget allows you to download the Mini Statement. If there are multiple accounts, then you need to select the account for which you want the Mini Statement.

section.title: Your Account Summary
section.para:
This widget displays the Banking and Loan accounts summary. The Banking and Loan accounts are displayed as two separate cards, click on the card to display the relevant account summary. By default, Banking card account summary is selected and displayed. The widget allows the following two types of filter:
Currency based summary display - The account summary is filtered based on the currency selected. Select the appropriate currency to display the account summary of applicable accounts.
Time period - You can select the time frame for which data needs to be displayed in graphical format.
The link to Account Summary Landing page is provided at the bottom of the widget. The following image is an illustration of the widget:

section.title: Deposit Accounts
section.para:
This widget displays a list of deposit accounts summary. You can perform following actions on each of the displayed account summary:
View Statement - Click on this action item to display the account statement.
View Details - Click on this action item to display the account details.
View Summary Details - Click on this action item to display the summary details.
Liquidate Term Deposit - Click on this action item to withdraw term deposit.
The following image is an illustration of the widget:

section.title: Most Active Accounts
section.para: This widget displays a list of most active account. You can download full or listed data in PDF, excel or csv format through the download icon present on top right corner of the table.
The following image is an illustration of the widget:

section.title: Favourite Accounts
section.para: This widget displays a list of accounts marked as favourite by you. You can "View Statement"or "View Details" of each account through the action items available under three dots icon. You can also download full or listed data in PDF, excel or csv format through the download icon present on top right corner of the table.
The following image is an illustration of the widget:

section.title: Loan Accounts
section.para: This widget displays a list of accounts against which loans are taken. You can "View Statement"or "View Details" of each account through the action items available under three dots icon. You can also download full or listed data in PDF, excel or csv format through the download icon present on top right corner of the table.
The following image is an illustration of the widget:

section.title: Transactions in Progress
section.para:
This widget displays the list of all in-progress transactions from various modules. Click on any of the listed transaction to navigate to Edit Transactions of the respective module. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to Pending Transactions.
The roles and permission define the logged in user's right to view transaction of various modules. If the user is assigned Trade permissions then only Trade transactions can be viewed by the user.

section.title: Calendar
section.para: This widget displays the calendar for the month and the current business date in your time zone is highlighted in violet text. The Calendar widget also serves as an Events reminder to the logged in user. The date on which an event is scheduled is highlighted. Click on the highlighted date to view scheduled event/s on the date. Click the arrows beside the month name to navigate between previous and following months.
Here is a sample view of the calendar.

section.title: Currency Converter
section.para: This widget enables you to check the amount in another currency. Select the From Currency and To Currency, enter the Amount, and the converted value is auto populated.

section.title: Pending Approvals
section.para: This widget displays the list of all pending approvals. Click on the required transaction to display the Retrieved Unsigned screen, where you can take appropriate action. Click View All Transactions to display the My Pending Transactions List screen.

section.title: Exchange Rate
section.para: This widget allows you to select a base currency from the list and displays the unit exchange rate. The exchange rate displayed in this widget is indicative of the current rate set by the bank in Fusion Corporate Channels database.

section.title: Action Required
section.para: This widget lists the transactions on which action is required. Click on the required transaction to display the Create Free Format Message for Import Letter of Credit (Action Required) screen and take appropriate action.
Click View All Transactions to navigate to Action Required screen.

section.title: DHL Tracking System
section.para: The Air Waybill Tracking link displays the DHL tracking website in a new tab. It allows you to track reports, notifications and/ or goods that you sent through DHL.

section.title: Ongoing Task
section.para: The Ongoing task widget displays all the tasks created across Fusion Corporate Channels for various products like Letter of Credit in Trade module, Fund Transfer in Cash module and so on.

The Task details are displayed in the following order:
System ID: Read Only field
Task Name: This is a link, click on the link to open the transaction against which the task is created.
Task Type: Read Only field
Creation Date: Read Only field
Task Description: Read Only field
Comments, if any: This is a link field, click on the link to open the comment box for this Task.
Click on the "Task Center" button to navigate to Tasks List, which displays a consolidated view of all the tasks created for all the products that the logged in user is entitled to view.

note.para: For detailed information on creation of new task, refer chapter "Collaboration Suite Module" in respective product user guides.

section.title: Bank News
section.para: The News Widget allows the bank to post news and information to their customers.

section.title: Bills Outstanding
section.para: This widget displays the outstanding bills in a graphical representation. It also displays the outstanding amount against each product of the module. Bills Outstanding

section.title: Loans Outstanding
section.para: This widget displays the outstanding loans in graphical representation.

section.title: Available Balance - Import
section.para: This widget displays graphical representation of the balance available against each product of Trade module. Available Balance - Import

section.title: Available Balance - Export
section.para: This widget displays graphical representation of the balance available against each product of Trade module. Available Balance - Export

section.title: Bank Approvals
section.para:
This widget displays polar representation of the bank approvals received in the last 15 days in various modules like Trade, Cash and so on. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to List of Transaction Notifications and search for transactions.
Bank Approvals

section.title: Bank Rejections
section.para:
This widget displays polar representation of the bank rejections received in the last 15 days in various modules like Trade, Cash and so on. Click on View All Transactions to navigate to List of Transaction Notifications and search for transactions.
Bank Rejections

section.title: Account Types
section.para:
This widget displays the amount available or liable to the corporate in the following three account types:
Deposits: Shows the total amount of term deposits in corporate accounts, click on
icon to view the account details.
Saving Account: Shows the total amount in corporate savings account, click on
icon to view the account details.
Loan: Shows the total amount of loans outstanding for the corporate, click on
icon to view the account details.
If there are multiple accounts linked to any of the above listed account then View All link takes you to respective Fusion Cash Management details page.
Account Types
This widget is controlled by permission btraccount_widget_access, which the bank administrator user can assign to its client. The data displayed in the widget is fetched from Fusion Cash Management.

section.title: Payments
section.para: This widget displays the recent five cash payments made by the corporate. Click on View All to navigate to Fusion Cash Management to view complete list of payments. Payments

This widget is controlled by permission, top5payment_widget_access, which the bank administrator user can assign to its client. The data displayed in the widget is fetched from Fusion Cash Management.

section.title: Loan Dashboard
section.para: This section describes the loan specific widgets that are available by default.

section.title: Dashboard Personalization
section.para:
You can personalize the Fusion Corporate Channels dashboard to suit your requirements. Click Personalize to add, delete or reposition widgets using drag and drop feature. Once the modifications are made on the dashboard click Save or Save As. The individual functionality of Save and Save As are described below:
Save: Click on this button to save the updates on the personalised dashboard. You can also rename the existing dashboard with new changes. This option is available only for personalised dashboards and not for dashboards provided by default.
Save As: Click on this button to save the dashboard as a new personalised dashboard. This option is available for dashboards provided by default and also for already created personalised dashboard. Use this option when you wish to save a new personalised dashboard
The saved dashboard can be viewed and selected from the User Profile Panel.

section.title: Feedback and Log Out
section.para:
When you log out of Fusion Corporate Channels, the Feedback Page is displayed. You are requested to rate your web experience on a scale of five, where five is the highest and one is the lowest. You can also share additional feedback in the text box. Feedback/Logout Page
The feedback you provide can be viewed by the authorized bank user.

section.title: Forgot Username or Password?
section.para: The 'Forgot Username or Password?' link under Login button enables you to reset the Password or retrieve your Username. Forgot Username or Password?

Click on the 'Forgot Username or Password?' link to open the Reset Password / Retrieve Username form. Ensure that you are on the right tab to Reset Password or Retrieve username and fill all the details. The individual fields of each tab are described in the following sections.

section.title: Reset Password
section.para: This tab enables you to reset password for your username. The following steps guide you to reset password.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID, Username and E-mail ID with valid data. Forgot Password
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next

Enter the the OTP (One Time Password) that you receive on your E-mail address on authentication page.
The OTP is valid only for 2 minutes, incase the time period expires the following message is displayed "The OTP is expired. Kindly regenerate the OTP and try again".
Authentication
Upon successful authentication, you are directed to 'Change Password' screen; enter the new password and Submit.

section.title: Retrieve Username
section.para: This section enables you to retrieve username. Follow the steps given below to retrieve username.

listitem.para: Enter the mandatory fields Corporate ID and E-mail ID with valid data. Retrieve Username
Click on the reCAPTCHA checkbox to validate that you are a human.
Click on Next, upon successful validation of data entered by you a success message is displayed.

section.title: Get Live Help
section.para: The Get Live Help feature enables you to resolve queries or seek assistance on transactions through a live chat/voice/video session with your bank relationship manager. Fusion Corporate Channels has partnered with Surfly to establish a secure communication channel between corporate user and bank relationship manager. The corporate user can share screen and can also pass on control to relationship manager. The solution also allows to hide confidential/sensitive data from relationship manager while using screen share feature.

chapter.title: Account Services
chapter.para:
The Account Services Menu on the toolbar, provides facilities to manage company accounts and transactions through the Fusion Corporate Channels.
The availability of the Account Services menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those functions the user is authorised to use, will be displayed.

This menu provides the following functions:
Account Summary
Display a summary of transactions for accounts the user has authority to use.
The term "account" is used in this section, to describe monetary accounts held at the bank. It is not used to describe User Login accounts.

section.title: Account Summary
section.para:
The Account Summary function allows you to see summary of various account types like current account, savings account and more. The Account Summary listing page is partitioned into following tabs:
All Account: Displays the account summary of account types like Term Deposit Account, Current Account, Savings Account, Loan Account and External Account.
Most Active Accounts: Displays the list of most active accounts the you have access to.
Group Accounts: Displays the accounts that are clubbed together to form a group. You can create a new group, edit an existing group and/or delete a group. You can filter the group accounts based on currency. Group Accounts only for the selected currency are displayed.
Payments and Collections: Displays the debit and credit history of the listed accounts.
To look up for a particular account information you can either navigate to a related tab and the parser scrolls to the relevant section or you can scroll manually to the account information and the focus on the tab automatically gets adjusted.
The following image illustrates the Account Summary landing page:

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Entity, Account Number, Nickname, Currency and Equivalent Currency. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant account records.

You can perform the following actions on the listed loan records:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of loan transactions.
CSV Download: Download the list of loan transactions displayed on the dashboard.
Customize: You can customize the order in which the account information is displayed. You can achieve following customizations through this feature:
Select the columns that you wish to display, unselect the column names to hide the columns.
Click on lock icon to freeze the position of the column. The freezed columns are placed on the left of screen. You can freeze a maximum of three columns.
You can drag and drop a column name to rearrange the table columns. Hover over multiple dots icon against each column name to, a hand icon appears, which suggests that the column is ready to be dragged and dropped.
This feature is available for all the tables of Fusion Corporate Channels.

chapter.title: Trade Services
chapter.para:
The Trade Services menu on the toolbar, provides facilities to manage trade instruments through Fusion Corporate Channels.
The availability of the Trade Services menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. The menu displays only those functions that the user is authorised to use.

List of options available under the menu are::
Import Letter of Credit
Create and manage Import Letters of credit.
Export Letter of Credit
Create and manage Export Letters of credit.
Import Collection
Manage Import Collections.
Export Collection
Create and manage Export Collections.
Undertaking Issued
Create and manage Undertaking Issued.
Undertaking Advised
Create and manage Undertaking Advised.
Financing Request
Create and manage Financing Requests.
Shipping Guarantee
Create and manage Shipping Guarantees.
Issued Standby LC
Create and manage Issued Standby Letters of Credit.
Received Standby LC
Create and manage Received Standby Letters of Credit.
Inward Remittance
Receive incoming notifications of remittances and do correspondence with the bank.
Funds Transfers
Request for funds transfer.
Letter of Indemnity
Create and manage Letters of Indemnity.

section.condition: TITLE=Trade Services: Import Letter Of Credit;PERM=lc_access;
section.para: Import Letter of Credit is an undertaking given by a bank (the Issuing Bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents guaranteeing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents, conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, are to be presented at a specified place.

The Import Letter of Credit module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the importer and applicant), to initiate Letter of Credit requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them and exchange messages about them with this bank.
The chapter for each individual module gives details and differences specific to the module.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms "LC", "Letter of Credit", "Import LC" and "Import Letter of Credit" interchangeably.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.condition: TITLE=Import Letter of Credit Landing Page;PERM=lc_access;ACCESS=LC_LCSTD_LP_UX
section.title: Import Letter of Credit Landing Page
section.para:
The Import Letter of Credit Landing page displays a list of LCs based on the transaction status. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.
The following image illustrates the Import Letter of Credit landing page:

listitem.para: Use this option to Create, Edit and Delete an Import Letter of Credit template.

Use this option to initiate a new request for Letter of Credit, enter the desired terms of a new LC and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.
The LC initiation feature is available only to maker user.

section.para:
The LC dashboard segregates transactions based on their current status like draft, awaiting authorization, awaiting response from client or bank rejected or purged from bank.The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual LCs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the LCs in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.
Actions
Lists all the Import Letters of Credit transactions on which the bank has requested action from client maker user.
Actions tab is available only to maker user.
Action will be based on the transaction status. This will list down transactions that is awaiting action from corporate user.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Import Letters of Credit transactions that are awaiting client approval from a second user within the corporate.
The Approve and Return action items are available only for checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to 'Approve' or 'Return' though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Import Letters of Credit that are awaiting bank approval.
Live
Lists all the approved Letter of Credit records and the expired Letter of Credit records by the bank.
The above mentioned actions are available only for maker user.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Letter of Credit records by the bank. The status given to such LCs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Import Letters of Credit transactions that are either expired or have been marked as purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Entity, Beneficiary Name, Currency and Expiry Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant LCs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed LCs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of LCs
CSV Download: Download the list of LCs displayed on the dashboard.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed LCs.

section.title: Information on Actions
section.para: This section describes all the actions that you can perform on Import LC transactions. The actions are available in relevant tabs based on the ribbon you are on.

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Click on Import LC Landing button at the top of Details page to navigate back to Import LC Landing page.
Click on Journey button at the top of Details page to view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
In case an action is pending on the corporate user, a Respond button is present against the stated event, that navigates user to screen to perform the respective action.
If you are viewing the transaction details of an amended transaction, you can use the Compare button to see a comparative view of amended transaction (N) and transaction on which amendment was made (N-1).
Additional Information: Lists the 'Attachments' added as part of this transaction and also displays 'Documents' and 'Fees and Charges' details.

section.title: Templates
section.para:
Click on Templates icon on the landing page to open the Template Maintenance form. The Template Maintenance form displays a list of templates that the corporate user has created. The list of templates are segregated over the following tabs:
Recently Updated: Lists all the recently updated templates.
Frequently Used: Lists all the frequently used templates.
All: Lists all the templates.

Click on Create Template button to create a new template form with the current details pre-saved. The system will request a template name to be entered that can be used at a later stage to create further Letters of Credit with similar details.

section.title: Request Letter of Credit
section.para: This section describes the Request Letter of Credit form. The form contains several functions and allows you to initiate various types of Import Letter of Credit request.

You can view all the sections of LC Initiation form and also navigate to any section from the left pane of Request Letter of Credit form. The sections are marked with a green tick
when all the mandatory fields of section are filled with valid values.

listitem.para: The Request Letter of Credit feature is available only for a maker user.
Fusion Corporate Channels provides a option to save the transaction each time user clicks on Next or manually saves the transaction.

section.para:
Amendment of an amended Import Letter of Credit transaction is property based. If the property trade.amend.restriction.enabled is set to 'true' then an LC transaction can be amended only once, then user must wait for bank's response to make another amendment on the transaction. If the property is set to 'False' then amendment over an already amended transaction is allowed.
This is applicable only to amendment transactions.

entry.guilabel: Is this a back to back LC?

entry.para: A Back-to-Back Credit is also known as a Counter Credit. It is often used as a method of finance to enable an export agent to buy goods from a supplier or manufacturer and sell them to a final buyer with a settlement effected by documentary credits.

In practice, the Back-to-Back LC can be described as an Import Letter of Credit initiated by the applicant from the details of an Export Letter of Credit for which the applicant is designated as the beneficiary. It is initiated against a Letter of credit advised to the user.
When you select this option, you are required to select a transaction from a list of your existing (non-purged) Export Commercial and Received Standby LCs.

entry.para: Slide the button to mark the transaction as provisional LC.

section.title: Licenses
section.para: Click on the Select License button and the List of licenses appears. Use License Number and Currency fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Secondary Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

section.para: An Export Letter of Credit (EL) or Documentary Credit is a banking mechanism that enables importers to offer secure terms to exporters. It is an undertaking given by a bank (the Issuing Bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents guaranteeing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents, conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, are to be presented at a specified place. This EL is raised by a bank for approval by an applicant from a third party.

Whereas the Import Letter of Credit module provides an interface for the applicant to request a Letter of Credit, this Export Letter of Credit module (EL) provides an interface for the beneficiary to receive and follow up a Letter of Credit.

This Export Letter of Credit module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the exporter and beneficiary), to receive notification of Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

section.title: Import Collection
section.para: Documentary Collection is a method of payment used in international trade, whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the banks instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer.
The two most common conditions for release are:

listitem.para: Documents will be released only if the importer makes immediate payment according to the contracted agreement between the exporter and the importer. Also known as a sight Collection.
Documents will be released only if the importer accepts the accompanying draft, thereby incurring an obligation to pay at a specified future date. Also known as a term Collection.

Documentary Collection is a method of payment used in international trade, whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the bank's instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer. The two most common conditions for release are:

listitem.para: Documents will be released only if the importer makes immediate payment according to the contracted agreement between the exporter and the importer. Also known as a sight Collection.
Documents will be released only if the importer accepts the accompanying draft, thereby incurring an obligation to pay at a specified future date. Also known as a term Collection.

section.para: The main advantages of Documentary Collection are that it is less complicated and less expensive than Letters of Credit - the documents are only released to the importer who needs them to fetch the goods when the payment or acceptance is effected.
However, this method presents a greater risk to the exporter than Letters of Credit, since no formal guarantee of payment is attached to its terms.
From its inception by the exporter to its ultimate recipient, the importer, the following parties are involved in a Documentary Collection:

listitem.para: The exporter (also known as the seller), who authorizes a bank (the Remitting Bank) to handle documents on its behalf.
The bank that the exporter authorizes to carry out the Collection on its behalf.
Any bank, other than the Remitting Bank, involved in obtaining payment or acceptance from the importer (drawee).
The Collecting Bank that presents the documents to the importer (drawee), usually the importer's bank.
The importer (also known as the buyer), who is presented with documents (financial and/or commercial) for the purpose of either payment or acceptance, in accordance with the Collection instructions.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "EC", "Export Collection" and "Export Documentary Collection" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Step-by-Step Process
section.para: The classical flow of a transaction under a Documentary Collection is:

listitem.para: A sales contract is established with the buyer, whereby it is agreed that payment will be made by Documentary Collection.

The delivery of goods to the transport company (air/sea/land) is arranged by the exporter. Exporter obtains transport documents from the carrier and prepares other documents as agreed with the importer.
The request to process the Collection is communicated to the Remitting Bank in one of the following two ways:

Regular Collection Instruction: the exporter gives a manually generated letter accompanied by the documents providing instructions on how to process the Collection to his Remitting Bank. This banks sends them on to the Presenting Bank.

Direct Collection Instruction: the exporter sends the documents directly to the Presenting Bank, often located in the country of the importer. He includes a cover letter bearing the Remitting Bank logo and indicating that they send the documents on its behalf. This method is usually used by exporters who settle large volumes of transactions through Collections.

The next step depends on the importer's response to the presentation of documents (payment, non-payment, acceptance of the bill of exchange, non-acceptance, protest, renegotiation, alternate buyer, etc.).

section.title: Overview
section.para: The Export Collection (EC) module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the drawer and seller and exporter) to initiate Documentary Collection requests, submit them to your chosen Remitting Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them and exchange messages about them with this bank.

Undertaking Issued (UI) is an independent documentary instrument issued by the bank. The bank initiates an irrevocable guarantee at the request of its customer (the instructing party / applicant). The sum of money is paid to a third party, (the beneficiary), provided a complying demand is made.

The undertaking may be termed as "Passive Instrument", as it is not usually drawn, because the applicant/instructing party and beneficiary generally settle the underlying contract/relationship outside of the undertaking. The undertaking remains until its expiry and serves as security under the commercial transaction. In most cases, demands are only made when the applicant/instructing party is in breach of its underlying contract/relationship.
The bank makes the payment to the beneficiary against a demand and presentation of specified documentation in accordance with the terms of the undertaking.

The Undertaking Issued user interface reflects the transaction request from the perspective of an applicant and the applicant's bank, typically known as the Issuing Bank. 'Issuance request' is the initial event that creates the UI transaction event. This event could only be created once per UI. If changes to the basic details of the UI are needed, an 'Amendment request' event could be created. Once the beneficiary submits their demand along with the specified documents to claim the payment, a 'Claims Received' event is created. The 'Amend' and 'Claims Received' events can be created multiple times and at any point in the UI lifecycle prior to its expiry. Issuance request can be for the final issuance of undertaking by the issuing bank or if this request is marked as “Provisional”, then it is for vetting the text of the undertaking by the issuing bank. On finalisation of the text between the corporate customer and the bank the actual undertaking will be issued by the bank.

note.para: Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.

You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. section.para: The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Channel Reference, Bank Reference, Event, Entity, Applicant Name, Beneficiary, Currency and Expiry Date. A Financing Request or Trade Financing (TF) is a transaction issued in the Fusion Corporate Channels by the client and sent to a designated bank (the lender, also called Issuing Bank of the loan in the rest of this document) whereby that import or export customer requests some form of financing for an International Trade transaction.

The use of the Financing Requests module is quite generic in the sense that it aims at providing transaction handling capabilities for various types of financing such as Import Loans, Export Discounts on a presentation of documents by an exporter, as well as Trust Receipts or for instance Export Pre-Financing.

To illustrate a possible use of this module, take the example of a Trust Receipt where the customer/importer is unable to pay for the cost of goods imported according to the terms of a Documentary Collection or even a Letter of Credit, and it is necessary for him to sell the goods first.

In such a case, the Fusion Corporate Channels Financing Requests module would be used by the customer to submit his request by specifying the expected maturity date, the amount of the sale and the schedule of the goods whose possession is held by the bank under this Trust Receipt agreement.

For an Export Pre-Financing or a Packing Credit, an exporter could typically use the module to submit the request for financing and specify its maturity date, amount and typically the details of the invoices to finance.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company, to initiate new requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

A Shipping Guarantee (SG) is an undertaking by a bank to the shipping owner or agent of a vessel, to release goods to the importer pending receipt of the original Bill of Lading. This helps the importer to clear the purchased goods under a Letter of Credit or a simple documentary collection while waiting for shipping documents to be presented. Hence it can for instance save the client from storage charges levied by the port authorities due to late arrival of the shipping documents or delays in clearance of the goods. Some Letters of Indemnity could also be handled through this module.

The Shipping Guarantee module of Fusion Corporate Channels enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the importer and applicant) to initiate new Shipping Guarantee requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

section.title: Preview
section.para: This section opens in read only mode and shows all the details that you have filled in the application and also allows you to either Save or Submit the application.

Issued Standby Letter of Credit acts like guarantee which means the beneficiary will receive a payment from the Issuing Bank in the event of default on a contract, provided that the complying documents (usually a sight draft) are presented.
Even though it is based on a flow of documents related to a business transaction between a buyer and seller, the Standby Letter of Credit is not directly related to the movement of goods.
A Standby Letter of Credit can be governed by either the UCP 500 rules or the more specific ISP 98 practices.

For business transactions that require regular exchanges between a buyer and a seller, a Standby Letter of Credit can include an Evergreen clause. This means the guarantee is automatically regularly renewed and so does not have an expiry date.

section.title: Flow of a Standby Letter of Credit
section.para: The life of a Standby Letter of Credit is similar to a commercial Letter of Credit as seen in the Import Letter of Credit module.

Once a contract has been signed, the buyer (applicant) asks his bank to issue an irrevocable Standby Letter of Credit in favour of the seller (beneficiary). The issuance and notification can be done directly by the Issuing Bank. It is usually recommended that the beneficiary should ask one of its local banks to add its confirmation.

The seller can draw on the guarantee by producing documents testifying that he has fulfilled his part of the contract and that the buyer has not. For that purpose, he attaches to his documents a signed certificate indicating that the applicant has not performed the required payment. Then the bank that issued the Standby Letter of Credit is should normally pay at sight.

Because this document checking and payment occur only in a case of default, a Standby Letter of Credit is generally considered simpler, quicker and cheaper than a standard commercial Letter of Credit.

section.title: Received Standby Letter of Credit Module
section.para: Just as the Export Letter of Credit is the beneficiary's view of the Letter of Credit, this Received Standby Letter of Credit (SR) module is the beneficiary's view of the Standby LC.

Whereas the Issued Standby LC module is for use by the applicant, this module provides the beneficiary with a notification of the terms issued in his favour, and a way to send further transactional messages to his advising banks on those records.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "SR", "Received Standby Letter Of Credit" and "Received Standby LC" are used interchangeably.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This Received Standby Letter of Credit module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary), to receive notification of Standby Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

This Issued Letter of Indemnity (or simply Letter of Indemnity) module enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant), to initiate Letter of Indemnity (LOI or LI) requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them.

The Letter of Indemnity is often used in Energy & Commodities (particularly Oil) trade transactions to allow the consignee to take delivery of goods without presenting the Bill of Lading (B/L) , which may have been delayed.

In the Oil business, goods often change hands during the course of the shipment in such a way that the B/L has not yet been passed to the previous intermediary in the chain. To retrieve the goods, the next consignee must therefore produce such a letter to the current shipper (company undertaking the transport of the goods). The format of the LOI should be mutually acceptable to both parties and should include title of the cargo, indemnity against non-production of documents such as the B/L, right to deliver bills, legal cost, governing law, and an obligation to put the receiver of the indemnity to funds.

From a Fusion Corporate Channels point of view, the Letter of Indemnity is very similar to the Shipping Guarantee. The main differences are that the latter is more specifically used for global trade rather for Energy & Commodities and the Shipping Company usually submits the form to be countersigned by the bank. In some cases, the LOI can also be issued by the seller towards the buyer.
The chapter for each individual module gives details and differences specific to the module.

section.title: Flow of a LOI
section.para: The life cycle of a Letter of Indemnity generally starts with a request from a customer of the bank asking for its issuance. There is no structured standardized communications from client to bank, and bank to client on a LOI, but such communications may happen and are supported in Fusion Corporate Channels, by the Correspondence feature of feature at the client and the Bank Reporting feature at the bank.

The LOI generally ends with the submission to the bank of some details or documents implying the cancellation of the Letter of Indemnity (for example,. the presentation of the Bill of Lading). This cancellation may happen automatically once required documents are presented under the Letter of Credit (LC) for which the bank acts as the Issuing Bank.

section.title: LOI in Fusion Corporate Channels
section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels implements the applicant side of the customer – bank relationship. The Issued Letter of Indemnity module offers the functions required for the submission of a new LOI request (compatible with both cases highlighted above: LOI for the shipper or LOI for the buyer) and the capability for both the applicant and the bank to further engage in free format communications about the request.

chapter.title: Lending Services
chapter.para:
The Lending Services menu on the toolbar, provides existing list of loans and facilities for managing and requesting loans through Fusion Corporate Channels. You can also inquire about bills against the loans and the compliance documents through toolbar menu item.
The availability of the Lending Services menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. The menu displays only those functions that the user is authorised to use.

List of options available under the menu are:
Loan
Provides the list of loans on which the user can request for loan increase, loan payment, rollover, and more.
Facilities
Displays a list of facilities that the logged in user has access to. You may also initiate a drawdown on an active facility.
Deals
Displays a list of deals that the logged in user has access to. Select a deal and all the associated facilities are listed. You may also initiate a drawdown on an active facility.
Fee Payments
Displays a list of various Fee Payments that were initiated. You can initiate a new Fee Payment for a Deal.
Compliance Documents
Displays a list of Pending Compliance documents.
Bills
Displays a list of the last nine pending bills.

section.para: A facility is a credit line available to the borrower and whose basis is either a line letter or a credit agreement. A deal consists of one or more facilities. A deal is structured for a company by a bank or group of banks to meet the company's financial needs.
To use the modules in Lending Services, your company must have arranged a deal with the Issuing Bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms "Drawdown" and "Loan" interchangeably. The term "Outstanding" is also used to represent the current amount borrowed against an existing facility.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Initiate Rollover
section.para:
This section provides the details on a loan rollover initiation. You can initiate a loan rollover request on the ongoing loans through following two ways:
Use the action icon available for applicable loan transactions - Hover over the list of transactions and click on the
icon to initiate a rollover for the loan transaction.
Multi Selection for Rollover - Slide this icon
to select multiple loan transactions. After selection of transactions click on "Rollover" icon to initiate rollover.
As a pre-condition to grouping loans for rollover, the loan transactions must be of same Facility, Pricing Option, Currency and Rollover date. Once a loan transaction is selected for rollover only the relevant transactions that conform are displayed and all the non-conforming transactions are removed from selection list.

chapter.title: Cash Services
chapter.para:
The Cash Services menu on the toolbar enables you to manage funds transfer and cash payments through Fusion Corporate Channels. You can also enquire or raise new requests for cheque books.
The availability of the Cash Services menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. The menu displays only those functions that the user is authorised to use.

List of options available under the menu are:
Cheque Services
Use this product to manage cheques issued against accounts the you have authority over, that are maintained by the Bank.
Term Deposit
Use this product to initiate the Term Deposit (TD) transactions and provide maturity/interest payment and withdrawal instructions. The bank and customer can also make inquiry on the TD transaction which has been created in the Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para:
The cheque listing page segregates Cheque Book requests based on their current status like draft, awaiting response from client or bank, completed and rejected from bank.The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual transaction or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Tab
Description
Draft
Lists all the cheques that are in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing cheque book requests that are awaiting client approval from a second user within the corporate.
The Approve and Return action items are available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple requests to 'Approve' or 'Return' though the checkbox provided for every request listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
